modmenu.descriptionTranslation.sodium-ex: Sodium Extra aims to bring most of OptiFine's visual enhancements to Sodium; in addition to providing features such as visual bug fixes and other performance options not yet available in Sodium.
modmenu.summaryTranslation.sodium-extra: Features that shouldn't be in Sodium.
options.particles.minecraft.angry_villag: Occurs when attacking a villager in a village, when villagers cannot breed because there aren't enough beds nearby, or when a panda is attacked by a player in the village.â€Œ
options.particles.minecraft.ash.tooltip: Naturally generated in the soul sand valley biome.
options.particles.minecraft.barrier.tool: Displayed when the player holds the Barrier item.
options.particles.minecraft.block.toolti: Appears when breaking blocks, sprinting, iron golems walking, armour stands falling.
options.particles.minecraft.bubble.toolt: Appears for entities in water, guardian laser beams, and fishing.
options.particles.minecraft.bubble_colum: Upward bubble columns created by soul sand underwater.
options.particles.minecraft.campfire_cos: Smoke produced by campfires and soul campfires.
options.particles.minecraft.campfire_sig: Smoke from campfires and soul campfires when placed above a hay bale.
options.particles.minecraft.cloud.toolti: Appears when an entity completes its death animation and disappears.
options.particles.minecraft.composter.to: If enabled, composter particles are displayed.
options.particles.minecraft.crimson_spor: Crimson particles generated in the crimson forest biome.
options.particles.minecraft.crit.tooltip: Occurs for critical hits, fully charged bow shots, crossbows, and evoker fangs.
options.particles.minecraft.current_down: Bubble column whirlpools created by magma blocks underwater.
options.particles.minecraft.damage_indic: Appears when mobs and players are hurt by a melee attack.
options.particles.minecraft.dragon_breat: Appears with an ender dragon's breath and dragon fireballs.
options.particles.minecraft.dripping_hon: Dripping honey through blocks that have not dripped down yet.
options.particles.minecraft.dripping_lav: Dripping lava through blocks that have not dripped down yet.
options.particles.minecraft.dripping_obs: Dripping particles from crying obsidian through blocks that have not dripped down yet.
options.particles.minecraft.dripping_wat: Dripping water through blocks, wet sponges, and leaves when raining, which have not dripped down yet.
options.particles.minecraft.dust.tooltip: Appears for redstone ore, powered redstone dust, redstone torches, and powered redstone repeaters.
options.particles.minecraft.dust_plume.t: Displayed when adding items to decorated pots.
options.particles.minecraft.effect.toolt: Appears with splash potions, lingering potions, bottles o' enchanting, and evokers.
options.particles.minecraft.electric_spa: Appears when a lightning bolt hits copper blocks.
options.particles.minecraft.enchant.tool: From bookshelves near an enchanting table.
options.particles.minecraft.enchanted_hi: Attacking with a sword or axe enchanted with Sharpness, Smite, or Bane of Arthropods.
options.particles.minecraft.entity_effec: Status effects, lingering potions, tipped arrows, trading, withered armour (linger potion particles decrease when the "minimal" particle setting is used).
options.particles.minecraft.explosion.to: Explosions, ghast fireballs, wither skulls, ender dragon death, shearing mooshrooms.
options.particles.minecraft.falling_drip: Falling lava particles from the pointed dripstone.
Falling water particles from the pointed dripstone.
options.particles.minecraft.falling_dust: Floating sand, gravel, concrete powder, and anvils.
options.particles.minecraft.falling_hone: Dripping honey through blocks that is dripping down in air.
options.particles.minecraft.falling_lava: Dripping lava through blocks that is dripping down in air.
options.particles.minecraft.falling_obsi: Dripping crying obsidian's particles through blocks that is dripping down in air and has fallen to the ground.
options.particles.minecraft.falling_spor: Dripping green particle from the spore blossom.
options.particles.minecraft.falling_wate: Dripping water through blocks that is dripping down in air and has fallen to the ground.
options.particles.minecraft.firework.too: Firework rocket trail and explosion (trail is not shown when the "minimal" particle setting is used), when dolphins track shipwrecks and underwater ruins.
options.particles.minecraft.flame.toolti: Torches, furnaces, magma cubes, monster spawners.
options.particles.minecraft.flash.toolti: Flash light when firework rocket explodes.
options.particles.minecraft.gust.tooltip: Created when a wind charge hits a block.
options.particles.minecraft.gust_emitter: Created when a wind charge hits a block. Spawns a number of gust particles.
Created when a wind charge hits a block. Spawns a number of gust particles.
options.particles.minecraft.happy_villag: Applying bone meal to a crop, trading with villagers, feeding baby animals, walking or jumping on turtle eggs.
options.particles.minecraft.infested.too: Produced by entities with the Infested effect.
options.particles.minecraft.instant_effe: Instant health/damage splash and lingering potions, spectral arrows.
options.particles.minecraft.item.tooltip: Eating, thrown eggs, splash potions, eyes of ender, breaking tools.
Produced by entities with the weaving effect.
options.particles.minecraft.item_slime.t: Slimes that land on the ground.
options.particles.minecraft.item_snowbal: Thrown snowballs, creating withers, creating iron golems.
options.particles.minecraft.landing_hone: Dripping honey through blocks that has fallen to the ground.
options.particles.minecraft.landing_lava: Dripping lava through blocks that has fallen to the ground.
options.particles.minecraft.landing_obsi: Dripping crying obsidian's particles through blocks that has fallen to the ground.
Fire, minecart with furnace, blazes, water flowing into lava, lava flowing into water.
Light block displays when the player holds the Light item of any level.
options.particles.minecraft.poof.tooltip: Explosions, death of mobs, mobs spawned from a monster spawner, silverfish infesting blocks.
options.particles.minecraft.portal.toolt: Nether portals, enderman, endermites, ender pearls, eyes of ender, ender chests, dragon eggs, teleporting from eating chorus fruits, end gateway portals.
options.particles.minecraft.raid_omen.to: Produced by players and mobs with the Raid Omen effect.
options.particles.minecraft.scrape.toolt: Scraping oxidation off a copper block with an axe.
options.particles.minecraft.sculk_soul.t: Appears when souls are absorbed by the sculk.
options.particles.minecraft.smoke.toolti: Torches, campfires, fire charges, flint and steel.
options.particles.minecraft.sonic_boom.t: Warden attacks that generate a shockwave of sound.
options.particles.minecraft.splash.toolt: Splashing in water or potion effects.
options.particles.minecraft.sweep_attack: Appears when performing a sweeping sword attack.
options.particles.minecraft.totem_of_und: When a player uses a Totem of Undying to avoid death.
options.particles.minecraft.vibration.to: Appears when sculk sensors detect vibrations.
options.particles.minecraft.warped_spore: Floating particles found in warped forests.
options.particles.minecraft.wax_on.toolt: When a player applies wax to copper blocks.
options.particles.minecraft.wax_off.tool: When a player removes wax from copper blocks.
options.particles.minecraft.white_ash.to: Ash particles found in soul sand valleys.
sodium-extra.option.fog_start.tooltip: Adjusts when the terrain fog begins to render for the player.
sodium-extra.option.instant_sneak.toolti: If enabled, the camera will not lerp upon sneaking.
If enabled, item frame name tags will be visible.
sodium-extra.option.item_frames.tooltip: If enabled, item frames are rendered.
sodium-extra.option.light_updates.toolti: If enabled, lighting updates will be processed. If disabled, this can affect lighting when generating new chunks. Only disable this if you know what you are doing.
sodium-extra.option.limit_beacon_beam_he: If enabled, beacon beams will be limited to the maximum height of the world.
sodium-extra.option.linear_flat_color_bl: Applies linear color biome blend without linear color blended block faces.
If enabled, per dimension fog sliders will be processed. If disabled, single fog slider will be processed. Upon changing this option user will need to leave menu and reenter to see fog sliders.
sodium-extra.option.overlay_corner.toolt: Determines which corner of the screen the overlay (FPS and Coordinates) will be rendered.
sodium-extra.option.piston.tooltip: If enabled, piston extending animations are rendered.
sodium-extra.option.player_name_tag.tool: If enabled, player name tags will be visible.
sodium-extra.option.prevent_shaders.tool: If enabled, any type of vanilla shaders will be prevented from loading. For example, the distorted view when spectating from a spider's point of view.
sodium-extra.option.rain_snow.tooltip: If enabled, rain & snow are rendered.
sodium-extra.option.rain_splash.tooltip: If enabled, rain splash particles are rendered.
sodium-extra.option.recipe_toast.tooltip: If enabled, recipe popups will be displayed.
sodium-extra.option.reduce_resolution_on:
Use half the resolution on retina displays, vastly improving performance on macOS.
Modifying this option will require a game restart.
sodium-extra.option.resolution.tooltip: Determines the resolution of the game when in fullscreen.
sodium-extra.option.show_coordinates.too: Displays player coordinates on the overlay.
sodium-extra.option.show_fps.tooltip: Displays the current FPS of the game on the overlay.
sodium-extra.option.show_fps_extended.to: Displays in additional information (max, average, and min FPS) alongside current FPS on the overlay.
sodium-extra.option.single_fog.tooltip:
Adjusts the fog effect distance on the terrain for all dimensions. Enable Multi Dimension Fog to control fog per dimension.
0 - use vanilla fog settings
1-32 - set fog distance in chunks
33 - max fog distance (essentially disables fog)
sodium-extra.option.sky.tooltip: If enabled, the sky will be rendered.
sodium-extra.option.sky_colors.tooltip: If enabled, sky colors are changed based on the biome.
sodium-extra.option.stars.tooltip: If enabled, the stars will be rendered.
sodium-extra.option.steady_debug_hud.too: If enabled, the debug hud will be refreshed at a certain amount of ticks configured by the Steady Debug Hud Refresh Rate.
sodium-extra.option.steady_debug_hud_ref: Adjusts the interval of when the debug hud will be refreshed in ticks.
sodium-extra.option.sun_moon.tooltip: If enabled, the sun and moon will be rendered.
sodium-extra.option.system_toast.tooltip: If enabled, system popups will be displayed.
sodium-extra.option.text_contrast.toolti:
Adjusts the contrast of the FPS/Coordinates counter.
- None: Default plain white text
- Background: Renders a background to the text like the debug menu
- Shadow: Plain white text with shadow
sodium-extra.option.toasts.tooltip: If enabled, advancement and crafting recipe popups will be displayed.
sodium-extra.option.tutorial_toast.toolt: If enabled, tutorial popups will be displayed.
sodium-extra.option.use_adaptive_sync.to: If enabled, V-Sync will be able to swap mid-frame and disable itself at times, usually notably helping responsiveness. May cause issues with some GPU drivers.
sodium-extra.option.use_fast_random.tool: If enabled, a fast random function will be used for block rendering. This can affect the rotation of randomly rotated textures when compared to vanilla.
sodium-extra.suggestRSO.message: It is highly recommended you install Reese's Sodium Options alongside Sodium Extra. Due to the growing amount of features, it no longer fits properly on Sodium's video options.
